page.title: 02LANDSCAPE
page.content: Yateley lies in the fertile area of the Blackwater Valley and has a very sandy soil with gravel and a layer of clay underneath. The extraction of gravel has led to the creation of several tracts of water which provide recreational facilities. The higher parts of the area are mainly heathland and scrub. The name Yateley is said to come from Yat - a gate - and ley - a clearing in a wood. A large part of the heathland is now a country park with rangers to look after it and is a conservation area, and has an enormous amount of wildlife, including badger setts which have been here for over 150 years. A nature trail has been in existence for many years. Some of this area is now becoming wooded as birch and pine take over.There are several picnic areas.
